==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ぶ|とう|yomi=o}}
{{wikipedia|butoh}}

===Etymology===
From {{m|ja|暗黒舞踏||dark dance|tr=あんこくぶとう, ankoku butō|sc=Jpan}} = {{m|ja|暗黒||dark, darkness|tr=あんこく, ankoku|sc=Jpan}} + {{m|ja|舞踏||dance|tr=ぶとう, butō|sc=Jpan}},
from {{m|ja|暗黒舞踊||darkness dance|tr=あんこくぶよう, ankoku buyō|sc=Jpan}}, by replacing {{m|ja|舞踊||(classical Japanese) dance|tr=ぶよう, buyō|sc=Jpan}} with the archaic {{m|ja|舞踏||dance|tr=ぶとう, butō|sc=Jpan}}.<ref>Kurihara, Nanako. The Most Remote thing in the Universe: Critical Analysis of Hijikata Tatsumi's Butoh Dance. Diss. New York U, 1996. Ann Arbor: UMI, 1996. 9706275</ref>

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ぶとう}}

# [[butoh]], a form of Japanese contemporary dance.
